greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (n mod 2)^(n mod 3).
comment: This is a periodic sequence with period 6. The repeating block is 1,1,0,1,0,1. - _Michel Dekking_, Sep 19 2020
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
formula: a(n) = 1 - ( (n+1)^2 mod (1+(n^2 mod 3)) ). - _Paolo P. Lava_, Nov 29 2006
maple: A093719:=n->(n mod 2)^(n mod 3): seq(A093719(n), n=0..40); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 13 2014
program: (MAGMA) [(n mod 2)^(n mod 3): n in [0..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 13 2014
(GAP) List([0..120],n->(n mod 2)^(n mod 3)); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Dec 19 2018
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 12 2004
